description:
**Note:** By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Waterloo, ON, Canada; Sunnyvale, CA, USA.
  
  

**Minimum qualifications:**  

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 4 years of interaction design experience in product design or UX design.
* Include a portfolio, website, or any other relevant link to your work in your resume (providing a viewable link or access instructions).


**Preferred qualifications:**  

* Bachelor's degree in design, computer science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
* 5 years of experience designing for user facing products.
* Experience with design and prototyping tools like Figma.
* Experience designing for Developer Tools.
* Experience with Artificial Intelligence (AI) tooling.


About the job
  
  

**At Google, we follow a simple but vital premise:** "Focus on the user and all else will follow." Google’s Interaction Designers take complex tasks and make them intuitive and easy\\-to\\-use for billions of people around the globe. Throughout the design process—from creating user flows and wireframes to building user interface mockups and prototypes—you’ll envision how people will experience our products, and bring that vision to life in a way that feels inspired, refined, and even magical.Google User Experience (UX) is made up of multi\\-disciplinary teams of UX Designers, Researchers, Writers, Content Strategists, Program Managers, and Engineers: we care deeply about the people who use our products. The UX team plays an integral part in gathering insights about the attitudes, emotions, and behaviors of people who use our products to inspire and inform design. We collaborate closely with each other and with engineering and product management to create industry\\-leading products that deliver value for the people who use them, and for Google’s businesses.As an Interaction Designer, you’ll rely on user\\-centered design methods to craft industry\\-leading user experiences—from concept to execution. Like all of our UX jobs, you’ll collaborate with your design partners to leverage and evolve the Google design language to build beautiful, innovative, inspired products that people love to use.
  
In this role, you'll design user interfaces and curate design systems for a suite of development tools for building, scaling, generating web and mobile software applications. You'll work with cross\\-functional team of Designers, Researchers, Program Managers, and Developers to understand the needs of modern app developers and create user\\-friendly interfaces that meet those needs.
  
Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise\\-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting\\-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
  
  

**For United States applicants:**  

The US base salary range for this full\\-time position is $122,000\\-$178,000 \\+ bonus \\+ equity \\+ benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job\\-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more aboutbenefits at Google.
  
Responsibilities
  
  

* Create detailed wireframes, mockups, prototypes, and specifications following a user\\-centered process to effectively communicate product goals and novel design solutions.
* Develop interaction patterns, define framework components, and apply visual styles consistent with Firebase design systems and the Google brand.
* Collaborate closely with product management, developing, and user research to define, test, and launch features that maximize end user, developer, and business value and impact.
* Take input, requirements, and feedback from multiple stakeholders across different cross\\-functional organizations. Participate in regular design reviews with a strong ability to communicate conceptual ideas and design rationale effectively.


Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See alsoGoogle's EEO Policy andEEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing ourAccommodations for Applicants form.

title: Software Engineer III, Full Stack, Payments
description:
**Minimum qualifications:**  

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 2 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, or 1 year of experience with an advanced degree in an industry setting.
* 2 years of experience with data structures or algorithms in either an academic or industry setting.
* 2 years of experience with full stack development, across back\\-end such as Java, Python, GO, or C\\+\\+ codebases, and front\\-end experience including JavaScript or TypeScript, HTML, CSS or equivalent.


**Preferred qualifications:**  

* Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science or related technical field.
* 2 years of experience with performance, large scale systems data analysis, visualization tools, or debugging.
* Experience developing accessible technologies.
* Proficiency in code and system health, diagnosis and resolution, and software test engineering.


About the job
  
  

Google's software engineers develop the next\\-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large\\-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast\\-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full\\-stack as we continue to push technology forward.
  
With your technical expertise you will manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables. You will design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions.
  
Whether it is paying online with Autofill, using tap and pay in stores, or using the Google Pay app, the Payments team at Google is focused on making payments simple, seamless, and secure. In addition to consumer payment technologies, the Payments team also powers the money movement between Google and its consumers and businesses.The US base salary range for this full\\-time position is $136,000\\-$200,000 \\+ bonus \\+ equity \\+ benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job\\-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more aboutbenefits at Google.
  
Responsibilities
  
  

* Write product or system development code.
* Participate in, or lead design reviews with peers and stakeholders to decide amongst available technologies.
* Review code developed by other developers and provide feedback to ensure best practices (e.g., style guidelines, checking code in, accuracy, testability, and efficiency).
* Contribute to existing documentation or educational content and adapt content based on product/program updates and user feedback.
* Triage product or system issues and debug/track/resolve by analyzing the sources of issues and the impact on hardware, network, or service operations and quality.


Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See alsoGoogle's EEO Policy andEEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing ourAccommodations for Applicants form.

title: Senior Software Engineer, Full Stack, Guided Support Experience
description:
**Note:** By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Sunnyvale, CA, USA; Boulder, CO, USA; Pittsburgh, PA, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA.
  
  

**Minimum qualifications:**  

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 5 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, and with data structures/algorithms.
* 3 years of experience with full stack development, across back\\-end such as Java, Python, GO, or C\\+\\+ codebases, and front\\-end experience including JavaScript or TypeScript, HTML, CSS or equivalent.
* 3 years of experience testing, maintaining, or launching software products, and 1 year of experience with software design and architecture.


**Preferred qualifications:**  

* Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science or related technical field.
* 1 year of experience in a technical leadership role.
* Experience with front end and back end frameworks for AI based app development.
* Experience with prompt engineering and optimization.
* Experience developing accessible technologies.


About the job
  
  

Google's software engineers develop the next\\-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large\\-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast\\-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full\\-stack as we continue to push technology forward.
  
In this role, you will be responsible for verticalizing the Guided Support Experience in the Google Help Center. The Guided Support Experience (GSE) team is responsible for our generative conversational support solution across our consumer product portfolio such as Google Play, Pixel, and Workspace. You will work closely with our Product Manager partners and other stakeholders in a cross\\-functional “pod” structure, each pod focusing on customizing GSE to the needs of our Product Verticals (PVs).In gTech Users and Products (gUP), our mission is to advocate for Google’s users by creating helpful and trusted experiences across the product ecosystem. We achieve this by meeting partners and consumers where they are with support and help, representing their needs with our product partners and proposing fixes and features that elevate their engagement with Google's diverse product ecosystem. Additionally we provide a range of product services that ensure our products are optimized for every user, no matter where they are in the world (e.g., localization, digitization, partner integration and more).
  
The US base salary range for this full\\-time position is $161,000\\-$239,000 \\+ bonus \\+ equity \\+ benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job\\-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more aboutbenefits at Google.
  
Responsibilities
  
  

* Write and test product or system development code, and review code developed by other developers and provide feedback to ensure best practices (e.g., style guidelines, checking code in, accuracy, testability, and efficiency).
* Participate in, or lead design reviews with peers and stakeholders to decide amongst available technologies.
* Contribute towards improving code health, data hygiene and overall system reliability, triaging product or system issues and debugging/tracking/resolving by analyzing the sources of issues.
* Work closely with pod partners to analyze user behavior and adapt the GSE platform to best support different product verticals and deliver a high\\-quality product.
* Analyze every touchpoint across the self\\-help journey and optimize GSE to guide engagement and successful outcomes.


Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See alsoGoogle's EEO Policy andEEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing ourAccommodations for Applicants form.

title: Software Development Engineer 4
description:
Our Company
  
  

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.
  
  

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!
  
  

Join Us in Shaping the Future of Mobile Experiences
  
As of early 2025, over 7 billion people worldwide use mobile devices, with approximately 6\\.9 billion being smartphone users. Mobile applications have become an integral part of daily life, driving billions of app downloads annually. They play a crucial role in communication, entertainment, commerce, and numerous other facets of modern living, underscoring their significance in the digital age.
  
Ready to redefine the future of mobile experiences? The Adobe Experience Cloud Mobile team is at the heart of the Adobe Journey Optimizer and Adobe Experience Platform, crafting personalized, multi\\-channel customer journeys and campaigns powered by unified, real\\-time customer data. Our mission is to empower businesses to deliver seamless, personalized experiences on mobile applications.
  
About the Role
  
We are looking for a dynamic Software Engineer—dedicated, innovative, and eager to learn new technologies. You will play a critical role in building scalable, high\\-performance services that power mobile experiences for large enterprises. This role goes beyond coding; it's about shaping the digital experiences of tomorrow.
  
What You’ll Do
  
**Engage in all aspects of web services development:** design, scoping, coding, code reviews, testing, bug fixes, and deployment.
  
Implement and maintain monitoring, alerting, and incident response processes to ensure maximum uptime and superior service quality for customers.
  
Participate in incident response, contributing to after\\-action investigations, reviews, and implementing improvements.
  
Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks, continuously seeking to enhance products and processes.
  
Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation for software architecture, design, and implementation.
  
Enhance test automation infrastructure to improve scale and velocity, ensuring quality across services and end\\-to\\-end product experiences.
  
Collaborate with cross\\-functional teams (UI/SDK developers, product managers, designers) to develop effective solutions.
  
Participate in story mapping, daily stand\\-ups, retrospectives, and sprint planning/demos within a two\\-week cadence.
  
Independently deliver complex functionalities and prototype ideas/concepts based on current trends and technologies.
  
Communicate clearly with team members and management to define and achieve goals.
  
Mentor and guide junior team members, fostering growth and development.
  
What You Need to Succeed
  
B.S. in Computer Science or a related engineering field.
  
5\\+ years of experience in designing and developing web or software applications.
  
Strong communication and teamwork skills, with a proven ability to build positive relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
  
Commitment to teamwork, self\\-organization, and continuous improvement.
  
Expertise in backend development with languages such as Java, Node.js, or Python.
  
Hands\\-on experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS or Azure), Kubernetes, GitOps, Terraform, Docker, and CI/CD pipelines.
  
Experience in setting up SLAs, SLOs, and SLIs for key services and establishing comprehensive monitoring practices.
  
Proficiency in writing functional, integration, and performance tests, and developing test frameworks.
  
Experience with both SQL and NoSQL databases.
  
Experience with Kafka and Zookeeper is a plus.
  
Experience in mobile application development is a plus.
  
Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several U.S. geographic markets, and we pay differently based on those defined markets. The U.S. pay range for this position is $133,900 \\-\\- $242,000 annually. Pay within this range varies by work location and may also depend on job\\-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for the job location during the hiring process.
  
  

At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC \\= base \\+ commission), and short\\-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non\\-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short\\-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP).
  
  

In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long\\-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.
  
  

Adobe will consider qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records for employment in accordance with state and local laws and “fair chance” ordinances.
  
  

Adobe is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based on gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law. Learn more.
  
  

Adobe aims to make Adobe.com accessible to any and all users. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation to navigate our website or complete the application process, email accommodations@adobe.com or call (408\\) 536\\-3015\\.
  
  

Adobe values a free and open marketplace for all employees and has policies in place to ensure that we do not enter into illegal agreements with other companies to not recruit or hire each other’s employees.

title: (USA)SENIOR MANAGER, SOFTWARE ENGINEERING
description:
**Position Summary...**
-----------------------

**What you'll do...**
---------------------

**\\*\\*Immigration Sponsorship is not available for this role\\*\\***

**About Team**


Omni Transportation is responsible for software led design, development, and operations for omni delivery network. We are dedicated to the mission of reshaping how our customers interacts with Walmart, making it frictionless and faster delivery. As an Engineer manager, you will be leading team to build experience for Walmart Customers, Drivers and transportation partners. We help bring a seamless experience to our customers irrespective of how and where they engage with us \\- while shopping online, delivery at home and picking groceries at stores. We operate at the intersection of huge Walmart deliveries for millions of customers, thousands of stores, and Walmart associates \\- a multi\\-layer multi\\-objective problem space which has a unique impact on Global consumer base.


We are tasked with building the foundational technologies for Infrastructure \\& platforms, vital to success at this scale paired with technical solutions for complex business workflows using cutting edge technologies. We are building low latency, high throughput eco system to support Walmart needs for US and International markets. Be Event driven architecture or Microservice or throttling pattern that serves experience for Walmart Transportation Network. All the work we do at Walmart Global tech benefits our operations \\& our associates, helping Customers Save Money and Time to Live Better.

 **What you'll do:**


As a **Senior Engineering Manager** for Global Transportation team at Walmart, you’ll have the opportunity to

* Oversee a team of engineers, providing guidance, coaching, career development opportunities and leading discussions to ensure adaptation of engineering best practices.
* Lead and inspire high\\-performing engineering teams.
* Hire and build a high performing, efficient team, and culture.
* Drive the adoption of coding standards, design patterns, and development best practices.

**Technical** **Leadership:**

* Modernizing software
* Implementing robust monitoring and alerting
* Automating routine tasks and improving operational efficiency
* Enhancing system performance, scalability, and availability
* Lead the creation and maintenance of our technical design and architecture for scalable, robust, and high\\-performance software aligning it with business goals and tech goals.
* Architect complex software systems, ensuring performance, security, and compliance needs are met.
* Drive the design, development, and implementation of cutting\\-edge solutions
* Consistently deliver high\\-quality software with a focus on unit testing, regular code reviews, and continuous integration.
* Uphold high standards in quality and operational excellence.
* Develop comprehensive technical documentation and presentations to clearly communicate architectural decisions and design options.
* Ensure documentation aligns with project scopes, milestones, and deliverables.
* Promote and enforce technical standards to achieve concrete outcomes and drive engineering excellence.
* Foster a culture of learning and innovation through hands\\-on technical guidance and mentorship.
* Lead the discovery and design phase of major projects, ensuring the design aligns with business goals and technical requirements.
* Collaborate with cross\\-functional teams for alignment towards solution and tech capabilities.

**Cross\\-functional** **Collaboration:**

* Collaborate closely with Users, Product Management, UX/UI, Quality Assurance, and DevOps teams for capabilities.
* Communicate complex technical concepts effectively to both technical and non\\-technical stakeholders.

**Innovation and** **Research:**

* Stay at the forefront of technological advancements, conducting research to identify emerging tools and methodologies.
* Write blogs to promote tech advancements and developer productivity.

 **What you'll bring:**

* BS/MS in Computer Science or related technical field.
* 5\\+ years of managing software development team across geography.
* Excellent interpersonal, problem solving and communications skills.
* Proven track record of managing and coaching software engineers.
* 1\\+ years of experience in software design and development of high scale applications development in product\\-based companies.
* 12\\+ years of experience building micro\\-services using JAVA.
* Strong background in computer science: algorithms and data structures.
* Proven experience with data security and data encryption for Public APIs.
* Deep understanding of micro services architecture, cloud computing (Private, Azure, or GCP), and containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes.
* Solid experience with databases (SQL and NoSQL) and data modelling for large\\-scale distributed systems.
* Proficient with design patterns, OOP, and/or Functional programming.
* Proficient in designing robust, large scale backend system, considering for performance, scalability, security, and maintainability.
* Experience with ML algorithms, tools, and ML systems is nice to have.
* Familiarity with front\\-end technologies such as React or Angular or mobile tech.
* Willingness to travel up to 20% of the time.

**Benefits \\& Perks**


Beyond competitive pay, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and more.

**Equal Opportunity Employer**


Walmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer – By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers, and the communities we serve live better when we know them. That means understanding, respecting, and valuing diversity\\- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas, and opinions – while being inclusive of all people.

**About Global Tech**


Imagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people and put a smile on their faces. That’s what we do at Walmart Global Tech. We’re a team of 15,000\\+ software engineers, data scientists, and service professionals within Walmart, the world’s largest retailer, delivering innovations that improve how our customers shop and empower our 2\\.2 million associates. To others, innovation looks like an app, service, or some code, but Walmart has always been about people. People are why we innovate, and people power our innovations. Being human\\-led is our true disruption.


At Walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance\\-based bonus awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. Health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage. Financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company\\-paid life insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. Other benefits include short\\-term and long\\-term disability, company discounts, Military Leave Pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more.
‎


‎


‎


You will also receive PTO and/or PPTO that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. The amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment. It will meet or exceed the requirements of paid sick leave laws, where applicable.
‎


For information about PTO, see https://one.walmart.com/notices.


‎


‎


Live Better U is a Walmart\\-paid education benefit program for full\\-time and part\\-time associates in Walmart and Sam's Club facilities. Programs range from high school completion to bachelor's degrees, including English Language Learning and short\\-form certificates. Tuition, books, and fees are completely paid for by Walmart.

Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to a specific plan or program terms.

For information about benefits and eligibility, see One.Walmart.

Additional compensation includes annual or quarterly performance bonuses.

title: Full-Stack Engineer
description:
We're seeking a talented full\\-stack engineer who embodies our values of resilience, execution focus, and mission\\-driven innovation. The ideal candidate isn't just a skilled engineer they're a builder who sees beyond code to understand the larger business and human impact of their work.
   

  

**About Us**
 Waterlily uses AI to help families prepare for the largest financial and medical event in their lives, long\\-term care (LTC). Through comprehensive care planning and optimization, Waterlily is bending Americas multi\\-trillion dollar LTC cost curve.
   

  

 Our Team \\& Culture
   

  

 We've built a high\\-performance team culture based on three core principles:
   

  

**Mission\\-Driven Excellence**
* We're deeply committed to transforming how families prepare for long\\-term care
* Every team member genuinely believes in our mission and understands its importance
* We prioritize work that drives meaningful impact for our customers and company


**Be a Potato: Growth \\& Resilience**
* We embrace challenges and adapt quickly \\- like potatoes that grow under any circumstances
* We make decisions swiftly while remaining thoughtful and open to iteration
* We focus on execution and results rather than just effort, recognizing that input doesn't necessarily equal output
* We value team members who show unlimited potential for growth and understanding


**Radical Transparency \\& Support**
* We practice direct, honest communication while maintaining empathy and respect
* Feedback flows freely in all directions \\- from intern to leadership and back
* We begin meetings with brief check\\-ins to understand each other's context
* We create safe spaces for vulnerability and authentic collaboration
* We maintain high standards while supporting each other's growth and wellbeing


 Our team comprises some of the brightest, most ambitious, playful, and friendly people youll meet. You'll be working closely with our founding Waterlily team, including Lily, Evan, Job, and Tim, and have direct access to a support team in the Philippines.
   

  

* Lily Vittayarukskul, our CEO, is a patented inventor who started college at 14, attending UC Berkeley, was working at NASA when she was 16, and lead product and engineering at IoT medical device startups for years before founding Waterlily.
* Evan Ehrenberg, our COO, is a member of Forbes 30 Under 30, started college at 11, also attending UC Berkeley, and then continued on to his Ph.D. in computational neuroscience at MIT at 16 before dropping out at 21 to found Clara Health, a clinical trials SaaS platform and B2B2C marketplace, which he sold 7 years later before joining Waterlily.
* Our founding engineer and data scientist, Tim Chung, holds a Masters of Computer Science from UPenn and is midway through a Data Science Masters at Georgia Tech. Tim excels in a trio of roles: data scientist, machine learning engineer, and full\\-stack software engineer. At his previous companies, he led teams to launch pioneering machine learning models.
* Our head of operations, Job Lawrence, holds a Masters from Harvard and MBA from the University of Michigan, worked directly alongside Sundar Pichai at early Google for over 10 years where he led strategy and operations, and has run finance, strategy, and ops for startups ranging from the earliest founding stages through Series D funding and beyond.


 How We Work
   

  

* We optimize for remote\\-first collaboration while maintaining high productivity
* We emphasize contextual decision\\-making and practical solutions
* We prioritize deep work and focused execution over unnecessary meetings
* We consistently validate that we're working on the highest\\-impact initiatives
* We maintain a healthy, growth\\-oriented mindset while pushing for exceptional results


 We're looking for teammates who share our values of integrity, empathy, and intelligent hard work \\- people who can see beyond their immediate role to understand both company needs and customer impact.
   

  

**About You**
**Growth Mindset \\& Adaptability**
* You're a "potato" \\- able to grow and thrive under any circumstances
* You have a track record of rapidly learning new technologies and business domains
* You see challenges as opportunities and adapt quickly to changing priorities
* You're comfortable with ambiguity and can make swift, informed decisions


**Innovation \\& Execution**
* You have a history of building solutions that challenge traditional approaches
* You can point to specific examples where you've used automation or AI to multiply your impact
* You focus on getting things done rather than achieving perfection on the first try
* You have experience or strong interest in leveraging LLMs and offshore teams as force multipliers


**Leadership \\& Communication**
* You give and receive direct feedback with grace and professionalism
* You can clearly explain complex technical concepts to non\\-technical stakeholders
* You're comfortable leading discussions and driving decisions
* You naturally build trust through transparency and reliable execution


**Mission Alignment**
* You're drawn to meaningful work that impacts families' lives
* You understand that sustained high performance requires maintaining personal wellbeing
* You're excited about joining a team that values both ambitious goals and sustainable pace
* You're genuinely interested in transforming how families prepare for long\\-term care


 The Ideal Background
   

  

 While we value potential over experience, you likely have:
   

  

* Demonstrated ability to own and deliver full\\-stack projects end\\-to\\-end
* Experience with modern web development frameworks and cloud architecture
* Track record of improving team efficiency through automation and process innovation
* History of taking initiative and driving results without extensive oversight


 We're not looking for someone who's done it all before we're looking for someone who has the raw talent and drive to help us pioneer new approaches to software development and team collaboration. If you're excited about pushing boundaries, learning rapidly, and making a real difference in people's lives, we want to talk to you.
   

  

**About The Role**
 You will be tasked with owning and scaling mission\\-critical features across the entire software stack. The goal will be to push beyond industry best\\-practices in software development by innovating new strategies that leverage LLMs and offshore teams to achieve company\\-defining results for a fraction of the time and cost of what other companies have previously achieved.
   

  

 You will be working with our founding US\\-based team and report directly to our co\\-founder and COO, Evan Ehrenberg, and you will grow to work with and support the management of a team of 40\\+ in the Philippines. You will collaborate on new ideas and implement quickly to test and iterate. Many ideas will not work and will be thrown away. Many ideas will need to be imperfect so that we can implement them faster. Everything will be iterative, no challenge will be too ambitious.
   

  

 You will be challenged to produce meaningful results every week. It will likely take you more than 40 hours per week to drive industry\\-leading results. We do not think that 80 hour weeks are sustainable or effective in the long run, and so while there may be incredibly important times where we mutually decide to be opportunistic to push ourselves to that amount of work to accomplish something very time sensitive, we expect you to generally limit yourself to 50\\-60 hour work\\-weeks. If you want to push harder we will urge you to reflect on ways to be more effective with your time so that you can dedicate your remaining time to benefit your mental and physical health.
   

  

 We will be in the trenches with you, and together we will create one of the most impactful companies that will help families prepare for what has historically been one of the most devastating times in their lives so that they can face long\\-term care with confidence and calm.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities ️**
* Product Driven Customer Success: Your mission is to surprise and delight our customers through product initiatives that go above and beyond to make Waterlily their favorite company to work with.
* Full\\-Stack Development Leadership: Own and architect mission\\-critical features across the entire software stack, from frontend React/TypeScript applications to backend Node.js services, ensuring scalable and maintainable solutions that meet enterprise customer needs.
* AI/ML Integration: Design and implement innovative solutions leveraging LLMs and AI technologies to automate workflows, enhance product capabilities, and create novel approaches to software development that surpass traditional industry practices.
* Technical Architecture \\& Scalability: Develop and maintain AWS serverless architecture while ensuring system reliability, performance, and security at scale as we service Fortune 100 customers and major insurance carriers.
* Product Engineering: Collaborate closely with founders to rapidly prototype, test, and iterate on new features, balancing speed of implementation with code quality to achieve fast market validation.
* Offshore Team Leadership: Work with and support the management of a 40\\+ person Philippines\\-based team for QA testing, establishing best practices for collaboration and implementing systems to maximize team efficiency.
* Process Innovation: Pioneer new approaches to software development by combining LLMs, automation tools, and offshore resources to achieve significant improvements in development speed and cost\\-effectiveness.
* Cross\\-functional Collaboration: Partner with various departments to identify technical solutions for business challenges, particularly in areas of customer success, sales operations, and marketing automation.
* Technical Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for systems, processes, and novel development approaches to enable knowledge sharing and team scaling.


**Key Skills \\& Qualifications** 
  

  

* Technical Expertise:
+ We know that the best engineers will pick up whatever tools they need on the job, but we also need you to hit the ground running, so be ready to learn very fast if you are not already familiar with certain tools in our stack.
+ Preferred Experience:
- Strong foundation in full\\-stack development using React, TypeScript, and Node.js
- Experience with AWS serverless architecture and cloud infrastructure
- Proficiency in Python for ML/algorithmic implementations
- Familiarity with modern development tools and practices including version control, CI/CD, and testing frameworks

* AI/LLM Proficiency:
+ Demonstrated experience with LLM integration and prompt engineering
+ Ability to identify opportunities for AI automation and implementation
+ Understanding of AI/ML best practices and limitations

* Leadership \\& Management:
+ Experience working with distributed teams
+ Strong project management skills with the ability to prioritize and execute on multiple initiatives
+ History of driving technical initiatives from conception to completion

* Problem\\-Solving \\& Innovation:
+ Proven ability to tackle complex technical challenges with innovative solutions
+ Experience optimizing development processes and improving team efficiency
+ Track record of implementing creative solutions that challenge traditional approaches
+ Comfort with ambiguity and ability to make decisions with incomplete information

* Communication \\& Collaboration:
+ Excellent written and verbal communication skills
+ Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non\\-technical stakeholders
+ Experience working directly with customers and external stakeholders
+ Strong documentation skills for both technical and process\\-related content

* Growth Mindset \\& Learning Agility:
+ Demonstrated history of rapid skill acquisition and adaptation
+ Eagerness to learn new technologies and methodologies
+ Self\\-motivated with the ability to work independently
+ Track record of staying current with industry trends and emerging technologies

* Business Acumen:
+ Understanding of startup environments and business priorities
+ Ability to balance technical excellence with business requirements
+ Experience with customer\\-facing roles or products
+ Knowledge of or interest in healthcare/finance/insurance technology

* Recommended Experience:
+ Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field (or equivalent practical experience)
+ 3\\+ years of full\\-stack development experience
+ Demonstrable portfolio of projects or contributions showing technical expertise
+ Experience with modern development workflows and tools


**Why Join Us?**
* Backed by top VCs: Our largest investor, Insight Partners, is a leading multi\\-billion dollar global firm renowned for backing innovative companies like Wiz, Calm, and Monday, and helping them grow to become industry leaders. Our Seed round was massively oversubscribed and saw many of our enterprise customers and prospects investing directly.
* Customers Love Us: Check out some of our latest success case studies and customer testimonials and see why our customers love us so much.
* Industry Giants Onboard: After launching in March this year weve already closed 3 Fortune 100 customers, 4 insurance carriers, one of the largest LTC providers in the Midwest, and one of the largest insurance distributors in the US.
* Direct Mentorship and Development from our Co\\-Founders: Receive guidance and resources to develop your skills and become an operator unlike anything this industry has seen before.
* Growth Opportunities: Learn to run your own product, directly interface with the enterprise executives who are our customers, work across multiple departments, and gain diverse experience that will propel your career forward.
* Impact: Play a key role in shaping the future of our company and making a tangible difference for families across America and the world.
* Dynamic Environment: Work in a fast\\-paced, innovative startup culture that encourages creativity and out\\-of\\-the\\-box thinking.

title: Remote Full Stack Web Developer | WFH Opportunity
description:
**Job Overview**
 We are in search of a talented Full Stack Web Developer to join our remote team, where you will play a pivotal role in enhancing and advancing our web application. This position involves migrating our existing Flask\\-based backend to a more contemporary and efficient FastAPI stack, as well as transforming the frontend into a modern JavaScript framework. Your expertise will be crucial in establishing best practices for development, creating thorough tests, and ensuring the application remains both scalable and maintainable. This is an exceptional opportunity for those dedicated to producing clean, high\\-performance code while significantly improving user experience.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Facilitate the transition of the current Flask backend to FastAPI, documenting the migration process and creating best practices for future development.
* Overhaul the existing Flask frontend by migrating it to a JavaScript framework (e.g., React, Vue), establishing testing and development practices that can be consistently followed.
* Assess and refine the current data model, ORM, and CRUD methods to ensure adherence to best practices, migrating the database and updating data models as necessary for enhanced performance and scalability.
* Develop a robust development pipeline, incorporating continuous integration (CI), continuous deployment (CD), and testing practices, while documenting these processes for future maintenance.
* Provide ongoing support for the growth of the web application, implementing new features and enhancing functionality based on stakeholder feedback.


**Required Skills**
* Demonstrated experience in developing RESTful APIs with modern Python (version 3\\.9 or later) using frameworks such as Flask, FastAPI, or Starlite.
* Solid expertise in creating reusable CRUD operations with ORM tools like SQLAlchemy.
* Profound knowledge of modern front\\-end JavaScript development and best practices, with hands\\-on experience in frameworks such as React or Vue.


**Qualifications**
* A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field is required.
* A minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in web development, with a strong focus on both backend and frontend technologies, particularly in migrating legacy systems to updated stacks.


**Career Growth Opportunities**
 This role presents significant opportunities for professional development as you contribute to the modernization of technology stacks and the establishment of development best practices. Your involvement will influence the trajectory of our web application and your skills will be enhanced through real\\-world challenges and collaborative efforts.
   

  

 Employment Type: Full\\-Time

title: Fullstack Software Engineer
description:
CHAOS Inc. is a global technology company delivering next\\-generation capabilities to the defense and critical industrial sectors. Founded in 2022 by a seasoned leadership team, CHAOS has quickly become the place where world\\-class multi\\-disciplinary engineers come to build mission\\-critical technologies. CHAOS has a mission\\-focused culture, dedicated to solving the toughest technical challenges. Its unique agile engineering approach enables rapid prototyping, while deep partnerships with defense and industry ensure real\\-world solutions.
 



  





**Role Overview** 




 CHAOS is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Software Engineer to join our team and help us build the next generation of sensor infrastructure. In this highly collaborative role, you’ll work in multiple parts of the stack and take on responsibility for large parts of the product.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Develop software that runs the CHAOS products – everything from the backend endpoints to the system diagnostics, operation, analysis, and testing
* As an early engineer on a growing team, define major parts of our software stack, including choice of frameworks and systems
* Backend engineering, primarily in python, to build the services that power our product
* Frontend engineering, primarily in typescript and react, to build the user interfaces
* Mentor other engineers as the team grows, and work with engineering leadership to define longer term roadmaps
* Support and collaborate with system, software, and hardware engineers
* Periodic travel to our other offices in LA, Washington DC, and London



  





**Minimum Requirements** 



* Minimum of 3\\-5 years of experience in software development using python, typescript, or equivalent
* Experience with modern software practices like git, unit tests, CI/CD, release management, etc
* Experiencing building, testing, and supporting major systems in production



  





**Preferred Requirements** 



* Development experience in Ground or Airborne Sensors (Radars, EO/IR, EW, etc.)
* Experience with data engineering/big data analysis
* Familiarity with Agile lifecycle processes including Scrum, Continuous Integration, and Test Driven Development Methodologies
* Experience with Software Defined Radios (e.g. Ettus)
* Experience with 2D and 3D Visualization ideally in defense use cases
* Experience with SW development tools enforcing SW\\-development best practices (e.g. linting, code coverage, code quality/security scanning, doc gen, etc.)
* Experience with SW Design, code, integration, and test of production systems
* Experience with git
* Familiarity with Azure or other cloud platforms
* Experience with additional languages such as Rust, NodeJS, Java, Bash, etc.
* Work with the commercial off\\-the\\-shelf (COTS) hardware (e.g. computers, switches, Software\\-Defined Radios, etc.)



  





**Why CHAOS?** 



* Health Benefits: Your medical, dental and vision benefits will be 100% paid for by the company
* Additional benefits: life, FSA, HSA, 401k (\\+ Company match), and more
* Our Perks: free lunch every day, ‘No meeting Fridays’, unlimited PTO (for exempt employees), casual dress code
* Compensation Components: competitive base salaries, generous pre\\-IPO stock option grants, relocation assistance \\+ (coming soon!) annual bonuses
* Company Size: 75 employees and counting!
* More About Us: We're building the next generation of aerospace, defense and critical industry technologies with a seasoned team of mission\\-focused individuals. We were founded in June 2022 and our goal is to become the platform where world\\-class engineers come to solve critical, real\\-world problems. We use agile engineering approaches which enable rapid prototyping, deep partnerships with the defense industry ensuring real\\-world application, and our newly\\-invented Coherence platform (through which we’ve made a fundamental breakthrough) improves sensor performance and decision\\-making in real\\-time. As of September, 2023 we have raised \\~$100M with 8VC as a leading investor. With a managing team that includes Epirus’ founding members (responsible for building a $1\\.5B company from scratch) \\+ key drivers from Palantir (instrumental in Palantir’s growth to $1B in revenue), we are well\\-positioned to become one of the fastest growing companies to date!



  





***Salary Range:***
 $130k \\- $210k
 



*The stated compensation range reflects only the targeted base compensation range and excludes additional earnings such as bonus, equity, and benefits. If your compensation requirements fall outside of the range, we still encourage you to apply. The salary range for this role is an estimate based on a range of compensation factors, inclusive of base salary only. Actual salary offer may vary based on (but not limited to) work experience, education and/or training, critical skills, and/or business considerations.*

title: Full-Stack Software Engineer - Mountain View, CA
description:
**Who We Are**
 CloudKitchens helps restaurateurs around the world succeed in online food delivery \\- our goal is to make food more affordable, higher quality ,and convenient for everyone.
   

  

 We take underutilized properties and transform them into smart kitchens so they can better serve restaurateurs, customers, and the neighborhoods they’re in. Every time we launch a new facility we create jobs in that neighborhood, and we’re proud to provide a wide range of cuisines and options for healthy food at an affordable price.
   

  

 We're changing the game for restaurateurs whether they’re entrepreneurs opening their first restaurant all the way through to your favorite global quick\\-service restaurant chains.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As a Software Engineer at CloudKitchens, you'll be an integral part of our data\\-driven development team, contributing to the evolution of cutting\\-edge external and internal tools. Your role will encompass a diverse range of responsibilities, including:
   

  

* Full\\-Stack Development: Develop and maintain back\\-end and some web front\\-end components of our software; back\\-end for our web\\-based and mobile interfaces
* Code Contribution: Write, debug, maintain, and test code for diverse projects
* Architectural Design: Design scalable systems with a focus on architecture
* Data\\-Driven Development: Contribute to a data\\-centric development team
* Project Planning: Engage in strategic planning for various services and applications
* Agile Methodologies: Implement and test software using agile methodologies
* Collaborative Teamwork: Work closely with a team to enhance and support technology
* Innovation: Drive innovation within the team and support CSS’ technological advancements


**What We’re Looking For**
* High energy rapid software development, iterating and pivoting quickly
* Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Software, Computer Engineering, or a related technical field
* Experience: 5 years minimum of the domain experience
* Individual Contribution: A track record of significant contributions in previous roles, showcasing your ability to make a meaningful impact
* Strong ability to design and create long\\-lasting architecture from scratch and evolve existing systems
* Strong communication and presentation skills
* Expertise with Java (BE Development) and Typescript or React (FE Development)


**Why join us**

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
**About Pow.bio**
 Founded by a UC Berkeley Ph.D. graduate and a SynBio veteran, Pow.bio is revolutionizing the $500B biomanufacturing market by building a self\\-driving fermenter platform that enables cost\\-effective scale\\-up solutions across a wide array of strains, organisms, and products.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 Pow.bio is revolutionizing the $500B biomanufacturing market with a unique approach to manufacturing layered with an AI driven platform that unlocks the cost barriers for hundreds of billions of dollars in critical products. Our mission is to revolutionize bio based manufacturing to meet today's needs and to build a sustainable future. We're driven by a shared vision to use novel and cost effective biology to address global challenges and bring sustainable products to market.
   

  

 We are seeking a
 **Director/Sr Director of Business Development** 
 to help shape and drive our growth strategy. In this role, you'll develop new partnerships, manage key client relationships, and lead efforts to bring Pow.bio's innovative technology to market.
   

  

**Your Role**
 We are seeking a full stack developer to build cutting edge smart fermentation tooling to drive next generation biomanufacturing. As part of a team developing a platform for driving, optimizing and managing fermentation experiments, you will work with in\\-house scientists and external customers to develop and support the Pow software platform. You will report to the Chief Technology Officer, and have a broad opportunity to design, implement, and innovate state of the art software.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Work with the CTO and software team to design and implement web based software systems that delights users!
* Work with Scientists and Fermentation operations to maximize impact of data on day\\-to\\-day lab operations
* Support and extend the ETL data pipeline for in\\-house data processing to deliver real time visibility across internal fermentation systems.
* Design, Implement, Test and Support features for the Pow fermentation optimization tools, including language tools, compilers and data visualization.
* Work with external customers to deliver web based software tools for designing, optimizing and running fermentation systems


**Requirements**
* Minimum of 5\\+ years software development experience with exposure to web, backend and database systems.
* Degree in relevant quantitative discipline
* Demonstrated ability to work well in a fast\\-paced, iterative, deadline\\-driven environment.
* Curious and keen learner interested in developing new skills
* Strong interpersonal skills and excellent communicator, able to speak to end users to understand their technical needs, learning relevant scientific knowledge as needed.
* Organized and able to mix tactical solutions with thinking about longer term investments


 Nice to Have
   

  

* Experience with Python / JavaScript/ F\\#
* Experience with Postgres
* Experience in a lab\\-like environment, especially Fermentation settings
* Experience delivering customer\\-facing software
* Experience with automation / control systems for lab hardware


**Work Arrangements:** 
 We want you to thrive in the work environment that suits you best. You have the flexibility to choose between being fully remote with occasional travel for team meetings, a hybrid setup, or working fully onsite.
   

  

**Compensation And Benefits**
 Pow.bio offers a competitive salary and benefits package, including:
   

  

* Flexible PTO and company\\-wide holidays
* Health, dental, and vision insurance
* 401(k) plan with match
* Commuter benefits


 The expected base salary range for this role is
 **$120,000 \\- $160,000 per year** 
 , depending on experience, location, and expertise. In addition to salary, we also offer equity participation and a benefits package designed to support our employees' well\\-being and career development.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 Pow.bio is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals, regardless of race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status.
   

  

 Legal authorization to work in the United States is required. We are unable to sponsor visas for this role.

 Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several  U.S. geographic markets, and we pay differently based on those defined markets.  At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC \\= base \\+ commission), and short\\-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non\\-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short\\-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP).
   

  

 In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long\\-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

 Full time

**About Gravity**
 Gravity is a venture\\-backed startup that helps industrial businesses and their supply chain partners manage and reduce their carbon footprint. Our software platform makes it smooth for companies to measure their emissions, reduce energy costs, decarbonize their operations, and promote their efforts. Our mission is to accelerate industrial decarbonization. And it's working: beyond carbon measurement, Gravity has identified and implemented tax rebates, energy efficiencies, on\\-site assessments, and more for our global customer base.
   

  

 The team hails from generational startups like Samsara, Tableau, and Flexport. Gravity's investors have funded legendary companies in both software and hardware, and sit on the boards of public renewables and battery companies. We even have tight links back to the roots of the EPA. (you'll have to ask about that one!)
   

  

**About The Role**
 Gravity will make the most impact by having the best product, and is on a mission to build the best engineering team. We are looking for frontend and full stack engineers who want to help us build a vibrant tech organization. Gravity hires engineers with broad technical skills, who are cross\\-functional and eager to solve a range of challenges.
   

  

 Our ideal candidate has a track record of building scalable systems, a strong sense of ownership, and enjoys owning projects from idea to production scale.
   

  

 At this stage, technical moats do not exist. The essence of the job is to ship relentlessly at high velocity, managing carefully\\-controlled tech debt over an extended period.
   

  

**In 3 Months In The Role, You Will Have**
* Built several major features and a dozen minor ones in a self\\-directed way
* Collaborated extensively Product, Design, and Climate Strategy departments
* Lead discussions and planning of multiple complex projects
* Pushed changes in real\\-time in response to errors or customer feedback

**You Need**
* Urgency, agency, customer obsession

* Track record of shipping high\\-quality products in record time. For most candidates, this means 5\\+ YOE.

**Benefits**
 Gravity is a mission\\-driven company with global ambition. Working here offers climate impact, competitive salary, outstanding benefits, meaningful equity, and flexible PTO. title: Remote Full Stack Developer | Web Applications
description:
**Job Overview**
 We are seeking a talented Full Stack Web Developer to join our dynamic team in a fully remote capacity. This role will focus on the development and enhancement of our web applications, including the migration and refactoring of existing backend and frontend systems. As a key player in our development efforts, you will establish best practices to ensure the long\\-term sustainability and maintainability of our applications.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

* Migrate and refactor our existing Flask backend to FastAPI, documenting and implementing best practices throughout the migration process.
* Transition the current Flask frontend to a modern JavaScript framework, ensuring robust testing and development practices are in place for future maintenance.
* Analyze the current data model, Object\\-Relational Mapping (ORM), and CRUD methodologies to align with best practices, updating the database and data models as required.

title: Senior Software Engineer, Autonomy Simulation
description:
Latitude AI (lat.ai) develops automated driving technologies, including L3, for Ford vehicles at scale. We're driven by the opportunity to reimagine what it's like to drive and make travel safer, less stressful, and more enjoyable for everyone.



When you join the Latitude team, you'll work alongside leading experts across machine learning and robotics, cloud platforms, mapping, sensors and compute systems, test operations, systems and safety engineering – ***all dedicated to making a real, positive impact on the driving experience for millions of people.***



As a Ford Motor Company subsidiary, we operate independently to develop automated driving technology at the speed of a technology startup. Latitude is headquartered in Pittsburgh with engineering centers in Dearborn, Mich., and Palo Alto, Calif.


**Meet the team:**



The Virtual Test Ecosystem (VTE) team is responsible for implementing the tooling used by Latitude to perform simulations (pure virtual scenarios where we can control interactions and sweep over permutations via a descriptive scenario language) and resimulations (rerunning logs collected on\\-vehicle using an updated version of the autonomy stack). This includes the backend C\\+\\+ simulation/resimulation frameworks that call the underlying autonomy tasks and Python\\-based tooling to run this at large scale in the cloud. This infrastructure enables us to do a large portion of testing before the code ever makes it on vehicle, dramatically reducing autonomy developer iteration time and allowing us to perform large scale safety testing.



We work closely and iteratively with autonomy teams to build out new sim/resim features that they need in order to evaluate their new autonomy features. Similarly, we work hand\\-in\\-hand with the offboard testing teams who are building out test coverage to ensure they can use our tooling to write the tests they need and to get feedback on how we can make this test creation more efficient. And of course we're constantly benchmarking and evaluating the efficiency and scalability of our applications in order to reduce runtimes and cost.


**What you'll do:**


* Add new features needed by autonomy teams and/or testing to the core C\\+\\+ simulation / resimulation framework. This could be a more complex interaction with other actors or some feature of the map. It could also be simulating a new portion of the autonomy stack, or intentionally introducing a degradation to some portion of the stack in order to determine how downstream components react
* Work directly with autonomy and testing teams to understand their needs and pain points, then internally propose features we can add to improve our infrastructure and/or simulation realism
* Support troubleshooting with users and bug fixes when issues are identified; we work with a variety of users on a daily basis
* Analyze simulation/resimulation reproducibility (does running the same code multiple times result in the exact same behavior?) and develop tooling to root\\-cause whether nondeterminism is coming from autonomy tasks or from the simulation/resimulation code
* Learn the autonomy stack at a level of depth that allows you to reason about what the best way is to wire in new autonomy features as they're developed, to be able to do some initial root\\-causing of crashes or issues to isolate what's going wrong (at which point the associated autonomy team would implement the actual fix), and in general to be an effective bridge between our team and the autonomy teams


**What you'll need to succeed:**


* Expertise in modern C\\+\\+ (C\\+\\+17\\)
* Self\\-driven to write code that's efficient, well\\-tested, well\\-documented, and conforms to our style guide
* 3\\+ years' experience with developing software for autonomous vehicles
* 1\\+ years' experience with developing software for some sort of simulation environment
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics or a related field and 4\\+ years of relevant experience (or Master's degree and 2\\+ years of relevant experience, or PhD)
* Strong communication skills and desire to partner with internal and external team members in order to create solutions that robustly solve the problem and allow us to evaluate the safety and performance of new features


**Nice to have:**


* Python development experience
* AWS or similar cloud experience


**What we offer you:**


* Competitive compensation packages
* High\\-quality individual and family medical, dental, and vision insurance
* Health savings account with available employer match
* Employer\\-matched 401(k) retirement plan with immediate vesting
* Employer\\-paid group term life insurance and the option to elect voluntary life insurance
* Paid parental leave
* Paid medical leave
* Unlimited vacation
* 15 paid holidays
* Complimentary daily lunches, beverages, and snacks for onsite employees
* Pre\\-tax spending accounts for healthcare and dependent care expenses
* Pre\\-tax commuter benefits
* Monthly wellness stipend
* Adoption/Surrogacy support program
* Backup child and elder care program
* Professional development reimbursement
* Employee assistance program
* Discounted programs that include legal services, identity theft protection, pet insurance, and more
* Company and team bonding outlets: employee resource groups, quarterly team activity stipend, and wellness initiatives


Learn more about Latitude's team, mission and career opportunities at lat.ai!



The expected base salary range for this full\\-time position in California is $174,000 \\- $261,000 USD. Actual starting pay will be based on job\\-related factors, including exact work location, experience, relevant training and education, and skill level. Latitude employees are also eligible to participate in Latitude's annual bonus programs, equity compensation, and generous Company benefits program, subject to eligibility requirements.



Candidates for positions with Latitude AI must be legally authorized to work in the United States on a permanent basis. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is available for this position.



We are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce. title: Technical Program Manager III, Core ML Platform, Cloud
description:
**Minimum qualifications:**  

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 5 years of experience in program management.
* Experience managing machine learning or artificial intelligence programs.
* Experience with large language models (LLMs).


**Preferred qualifications:**  

* 5 years of experience managing cross\\-functional or cross\\-team projects.

* Experience in ML life\\-cycle management.
* Excellent organizational, multitasking, and prioritization skills, with attention to detail.
* Excellent communication skills, with a data driven analytical approach towards solving challenges.


About the job
  
  

A problem isn’t truly solved until it’s solved for all. That’s why Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you’ll use your technical expertise to lead complex, multi\\-disciplinary projects from start to finish. You’ll work with stakeholders to plan requirements, identify risks, manage project schedules, and communicate clearly with cross\\-functional partners across the company. You're equally comfortable explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical tradeoffs in product development with engineers.Our goal is to build a Google that looks like the world around us — and we want Googlers to stay and grow when they join us. As part of our efforts to build a Google for everyone, we build diversity, equity, and inclusion into our work and we aim to cultivate a sense of belonging throughout the company.
  
Core ML is the central machine learning platform team that provides ML software tools, services, solutions, and infrastructure to all the Google product areas, including Search, Ads, YouTube, Cloud, Maps, etc. The team's goal is to make it easier to perform ML experimentation, development, and production.
  
Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise\\-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting\\-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
  
The US base salary range for this full\\-time position is $142,000\\-$211,000 \\+ bonus \\+ equity \\+ benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. title: Principal Data Engineer
description:
Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life\\-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic medicines. Our 114,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.

**Working at Abbott**

At Abbott, you can do work that matters, grow, and learn, care for yourself and family, be your true self and live a full life. You’ll also have access to:

* Career development with an international company where you can grow the career you dream of.
* Free medical coverage for employees\\* via the Health Investment Plan (HIP) PPO
* An excellent retirement savings plan with high employer contribution
* Tuition reimbursement, the Freedom 2 Save student debt program and FreeU education benefit \\- an affordable and convenient path to getting a bachelor’s degree.
* A company recognized as a great place to work in dozens of countries around the world and named one of the most admired companies in the world by Fortune.
* A company that is recognized as one of the best big companies to work for as well as a best place to work for diversity, working mothers, female executives, and scientists.
 **About Lingo**


Meet Lingo, a new biosensing technology that provides users a window into their body. Lingo tracks key biomarkers – such as glucose, ketones, and lactate – to help people make better decisions about their health and nutrition. Biowearable technology will digitize, decentralize and democratize healthcare, enabling consumers to take control of their own health.

**The Opportunity**


This position works out of our Alameda location in the Lingo Division. We are seeking a Principal Data Engineer with deep expertise in Apache Spark to join our team. You will play a critical role in helping us deliver clinically validated, regulatory grade digital health products and solutions in preventive care using Bio\\-Wearables. As a senior leader in data engineering, you will help design, develop, and optimize a large\\-scale real\\-time data processing system. You will work closely with data analysts, scientists, system designers, and software developers to build scalable data services, pipelines and interfaces to support our mission. This is a hands\\-on technical role requiring strong problem\\-solving skills and deep knowledge of distributed systems.

**What** **You’ll****Work On**

* Design, implement, and optimize Apache Spark jobs to define, schedule, monitor, and control data processes.
* Develop, test and deploy algorithms for large\\-scale machine learning in a production environment.
* Optimize Spark jobs to maximize speed, scalability and compliance with data\\-use regulations.
* Manage robust data pipelines: acquisition, transformation, and processing workflows.
* Perform advanced data processing and exploratory analysis • Build and deploy machine learning models using Spark or MapReduce, and present results through intuitive visualizations.
* Collaborate with other spark developers and back\\-end data engineers to design and develop interactive Spark pipelines.
* Develop and maintain REST APIs to manage Spark jobs and facilitate data workflows.
* Ensure seamless integration of pipelines with distributed file and database systems.

**Required** **Qualifications**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* 5\\+ years of experience in building and optimizing data processing pipelines.
* Expertise in Apache Spark, including Spark SQL, RDD, DataFrame, Dataset APIs, and PySpark.
* Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, and Java (Scala is a plus).
* In\\-depth understanding of Spark internals and real\\-time streaming technology (e.g., Kafka, KSQL, etc.)
* Strong experience with big data processing tools (Experience with Apache Druid is a huge plus).
* Familiarity with ETL tools and expertise in managing post\\-loading transformations.
* Advanced knowledge of distributed file systems like HDFS, S3, or Ceph.
* Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS or Azure for building Apache Spark clusters.
* Understanding of machine learning algorithms and their application in large\\-scale data environments.
* Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or others).
* Strong communication and collaboration skills, with a proven ability to work cross functionally with analysts, scientists and developers.


Apply Now

* Participants who complete a short wellness assessment qualify for FREE coverage in our HIP PPO medical plan. Free coverage applies in the next calendar year.

**Learn more about our health and wellness** **benefits****, which provide the security to help you and your family** **live** **full lives****:** www.abbottbenefits.com


Follow your career aspirations to Abbott for diverse opportunities with a company that can help you build your future and live your best life. Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to employee diversity.


Connect with us at www.abbott.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Abbott and on Twitter @AbbottNews.

  

The base pay for this position is $128,000\\.00 – $256,000\\.00\\. In specific locations, the pay range may vary from the range posted.
